name: cradle chair
description: These are handmade units made in New Zealand. For more information or to reserve a unit please email here: clarksondesign@me.com  Each chair is handmade in New Zealand from local materials, and is designed for indoor use. They are shipped flatpack and will need to be assembled upon arrival. The chairs retail at $8400 USD each plus shipping. The next small run of chairs will be ready for shipment in Jan 2014. International Shipping time is an estimated 7-10 days. Floorspace occupied: 110"L x 50"W x 101"H Product Weight: 100lbs We have called our rocking chair “cradle” as is epitomizes what the chair is all about. It is about creating a safe, comfortable and relaxing environment in which the user can dissipate the over-stimulation of their senses. The design was heavily directed by a synthesis of research into Autism and children with Rhythmic Movement Disorder (RMD) as well as safety, sustainability, function and aesthetics. We had a strong focus creating a solution for sufferers of RMD but the chair is not exclusively for them and will bring relaxation, comfort and calmness to anyone. Original Concept by Richard Clarkson, Grace Emmanual, Kalivia Russel, Eamon Moore, Brodie Cambell, Jeremy Brooker, Joya Boerrigter at Victoria University of Wellington. Read More...

name: cloud
description: On one hand, ‘Cloud’ is an Arduino-controlled, motion-triggered lightning & thunder performance. On the other, it is a music-activated visualizer and suspended speaker unit.” Acting as both a semi-immersive lightning experience, or as speaker with visual feedback, this nightlight/nightspeaker hybrid introduces a new discourse for what a nightlight could be. Richard writes: “Advances in physical computing and interaction design hardware over recent years have created a new breed of smartobjects, which are gaining more and more traction in the design world. Please allow 14-21 days lead time. Options: The Smart cloud is the fully featured unit. Remote, Color changing lights, Speakers, motion detection & more. For those desiring the aesthetic but not the price-tag the 'Lamp Only' option may be more suitable. This option features a powerful Philips LED bulb which provides plenty of sunshine. The satellite cloud is a small 'aesthetic only' add on to your "Smart" or "Lamp Only' cloud and helps creates a more realistic sky environment. Read More...

name: U Stool
description: Designed by Richard Clarkson, Zena Verda Pesta and Clay Kippen. As part of a Materials research course at SVA at Material Connexion, we where given the challenge of exploring new materials through the lens of sustainability. Our group created upon a stool that encouraged active sitting, used significantly less energy in the manufacturing process, and would be compostable in such a way as to become land-art in its afterlife. Read More...

name: Floral Headphones
description: Headphones fixed both functionally and aesthetically. The sound of the Sony drivers is really good but the original design needed improving. So I upholstery a pair and created a head-suspension system to make them more durable and more comfortable. Read More...

name: Zag Zig Table
description: Originally designed as part of a Modular Exhibition series this piece can be assembled and dissembled in 2.84 seconds. This is due to the fiction held cantilever system which uses no glue or screws. Read More...

name: (@#$% YOU THE ROPE IS GOING TO GO THROUGH THE SEAT) chair
description: Using a similar rope treatment as in the U-stool. This piece of furniture utilizes tension to hold itself together. Its harsh lines and intersections contrast with the simple form of the legs and frame. Comes flat-pack with encouragement to experiment with various rope patterns and layouts. This also allows for adjustability and customization of the chair to suit the clients needs.

name: Wooden iPhone 5 Replacement Ranels
description: After having my iPhone 5 for just over a week I walked into the corner of a desk with it in my pocket and smashed the top panel. Unfortunately I didn't buy Apple Care when I purchased the phone but after some investigating I found that the broken panel could be removed and replaced. After very carefully removing the remaining smashed pieces of glass with tweezers, I made my own wooden panel. The panels are adhesive backed and come in four colors; Neutral, Cherry, Golden Oak & Red Oak. The wood is wax finished to make it water resistant and still retain its beautiful wooden tactility. Come in Sets of two panels - one top & one bottom. Note: Please be very careful removing the existing panels, broken or not. The seller takes no responsibility for increased damage or the voiding of warranty to Apple products. Read More...

name: Mr Indescision
description: This project started by using 123D Catch, a new Adobe software, to get a 3D scan of my whole body. I cleaned up the scan and manipulated it to work with 123D Make. Using this program, I sliced the model into the proper layers and size for laser cutting. Once I finished laser cutting, I integrated the electronics, including a motion sensor, and Arduino to make the head turn. I created two functions, an automatic tracking function and a manually controlled function through Max MSP. In a way this is a modern day puppet. Read More...
